author: Robert Greene
key_insights: Always conceal your true intentions and keep others guessing to maintain an advantage and prevent opposition.
Never outshine the master; make those in power feel superior and secure to avoid jealousy and secure your position.
Court attention at all costs, as being noticed, even controversially, is better than being ignored in the struggle for power.
Use selective honesty and generosity to disarm opponents and create an illusion of trustworthiness, making them vulnerable.
Master the art of timing, knowing when to act decisively and when to patiently wait for the opportune moment.
action_steps: Before any significant interaction, identify your ultimate goal and plan indirect steps to achieve it without revealing your hand.
When presenting ideas or achieving successes, always credit your superiors or colleagues first, allowing them to take the spotlight.
Regularly assess how you are perceived by others and actively seek ways to stand out positively or distinctively in your field.
Cultivate a reputation for certain virtues, even if selectively applied, to build trust that can be leveraged when needed.
Develop patience in your plans, observing situations for the perfect moment to strike or retreat, rather than acting impulsively.
